message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SI

This paper discusses the phenomenon of cryptojacking, which involves the abuse of computing resources of website visitors to mine for cryptocurrencies. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) and networked systems (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the prevalence of cryptojacking in the Alexa 1 million websites, which involves a large-scale study and data analysis, indicating a focus on distributed systems (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper evaluates current blacklist-based countermeasures, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
